summary: The Small Business Energy Loan Enhancement Act (H.R. 2831) amends the Small Business Investment Act of 1958 to increase the maximum loan amount for certain energy-related loans. Specifically, it raises the maximum loan amount under clauses (iv) and (v) of section 502(2)(A) of the Act from $5,500,000 to $10,000,000.  The bill also mandates the Small Business Administration to submit annual reports detailing the industries and geographic areas receiving these loans.
